version_description:
The second major update to Trade Rumors! iOS users can now read and contribute to the Comments section of all the articles.

- Comments are now displayed in-app under each article.

- Log in using your existing Trade Rumors account (from MLB Trade Rumors, Hoops Rumors, or Pro Football Rumors), or sign up for one in-app to join the discussion.

- Support for iOS 9's great new features like split screen multitasking and the new in-app browser.

We were hard at work over the holidays to make the comment update work better than ever. Articles with comments on them (even those with 300+ comments!) now open lightening-fast. No more lag when you open articles or swipe between them.

Also focused on squashing some of the top bugs / crashes we're seeing users hit.
Quick update to fix a few more bugs.

We had some server issues yesterday and that affected the app's ability to download stories. This update fixes issues associated with those server changes. Sorry for any problems reading stories yesterday.

- Fixed a bug where comments were getting squished on iOS 8.
- Fixed a layout bug on iPad Pro when you were following only 2 streams.

- Support for activation email
- Various bug fixes

- Improved first-launch experience to help you customize your news feed and ensure you see the news and rumors you care about most.
- Polished reading experience, especially on iPhones. We've focused on giving you as much screen space as possible dedicated to the article itself.
- Support for 3D Touch. Peek and Pop articles and web links on the latest iOS devices.
- Support for Handoff. Easily switch between iOS and Mac devices when reading an article.
- Support for Universal Links. The Trade Rumors app can now open article links from emails, messages, Facebook, and more, directly in-app for a much faster load experience.

A few small bugfixes.
Fixed several bugs.

Pro Hockey Rumors is now available in the app! Get the latest news and rumors on your favorite hockey teams and players.

We've also had to migrate away from our push notification provider. You'll need to update to this version to maintain the ability to change which sports, teams, and players you're receiving notifications for. Anyone on a version before v1.4 will no longer be able to change their notification preferences (although they will still receive push notifications they had previously signed up for).

- Fix for users who weren't seeing the new hockey teams / players as stream options.
- Fix for commenting on hockey news.
Bugfix for some user experiencing push notification issues.

- iOS 10 rich notifications are now supported.
- Voiceover improvements, including support for the back gesture and restoring your position in the home feed when you leave an article.
- Checking for new stories as been sped up, especially on comment-heavy feeds like baseball.
- Fixed an issue where feed titles where not getting properly updated, like when a team changes cities.
- Fixed an issue where header images weren't being deleted over time, leading to excessive disk usage.
- Squashed more of the top crash-causers.

Note: this update, and future ones, now requires iOS 10 which Apple shipped in September of 2016.
- Speed-up of checking for new stories on team / player feeds.

- Tapping on a link in an article to a Trade Rumors story now loads like a normal Trade Rumors article, not in a web window.
- Fixed a crash that could happen when checking for new stories.

- Tapping on a link in an article to a Trade Rumors story now loads like a normal Trade Rumors article, not in a web window.
- Fixed a crash that could happen when checking for new stories.

- Support for the iPhone X.
- Fixed a case where some links in articles weren't tappable.
- Fixed a case where news articles for Hoops would be labeled as Hockey in notifications.
- Bug fixes.
Removal of newsfeed ad.
- Added support for the new iPad Pros

• Dark Mode support - if you run your device in Dark Mode, Trade Rumors will now have an updated dark look.
• Fixed a few layout bugs
• Other minor fixes and improvements

Fixed a bug that was making embed content not render properly.
Other small improvements.
Internal improvements and bug fixes.
Fixed a few minor issues with account login and ad display.

We've added the ability to like comments, just like on the web. We've also added the ability to flag comments that you feel are inappropriate, so we can better moderate our forums.

Thanks. If you enjoy using Trade Rumors, please consider leaving a rating or review. It really helps. Thanks.
